 This is some more text to make the content longer and demonstrate scrolling. If you drag the dividers, you'll see the regions resize, and this text will either shrink or expand within its bounds, becoming scrollable if it exceeds the available space. 

 Another paragraph for good measure. Vivamus magna justo, lacinia eget consectetur sed, convallis at tellus. Nulla quis lorem ut libero malesuada feugiat. THIS IS A MUCH LONGER TEXT FOR THE RIGHT MAIN AREA. IT IS MEANT TO SHOWCASE HOW SCROLLING WORKS WHEN THE CONTENT IS OVERFLOWING THE GIVEN SPACE. DRAG THE DIVIDER LINES TO CHANGE THE SIZE OF THIS AREA, AND YOU WILL SEE HOW THE SCROLLVIEW ADAPTS.

 And even more text to ensure it truly overflows and demonstrates the vertical scrolling capability effectively. This dynamic resizing is very useful for dashboard-like interfaces or multi-pane layouts where users need to prioritize certain information. 

 Final paragraph to make sure the scrollbar is always visible when the area is small. Fusce id felis volutpat, sollicitudin urna at, feugiat ipsum.
